00030 /*
00031  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00032  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00033  *
00034  * lnet/include/lnet/socklnd.h
00035  *
00036  * #defines shared between socknal implementation and utilities
00037  */
00038 #ifndef __LNET_LNET_SOCKLND_H__
00039 #define __LNET_LNET_SOCKLND_H__
00040 
00041 #include <lnet/types.h>
00042 
00043 #define SOCKLND_CONN_NONE     (-1)
00044 #define SOCKLND_CONN_ANY        0
00045 #define SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL    1
00046 #define SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN    2
00047 #define SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT   3
00048 #define SOCKLND_CONN_NTYPES     4
00049 
00050 #define SOCKLND_CONN_ACK        SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN
00051 
00052 typedef struct {
00053         __u32                   kshm_magic;     /* magic number of socklnd message */
00054         __u32                   kshm_version;   /* version of socklnd message */
00055         lnet_nid_t              kshm_src_nid;   /* sender's nid */
00056         lnet_nid_t              kshm_dst_nid;   /* destination nid */
00057         lnet_pid_t              kshm_src_pid;   /* sender's pid */
00058         lnet_pid_t              kshm_dst_pid;   /* destination pid */
00059         __u64                   kshm_src_incarnation; /* sender's incarnation */
00060         __u64                   kshm_dst_incarnation; /* destination's incarnation */
00061         __u32                   kshm_ctype;     /* connection type */
00062         __u32                   kshm_nips;      /* # IP addrs */
00063         __u32                   kshm_ips[0];    /* IP addrs */
00064 } WIRE_ATTR ksock_hello_msg_t;
00065 
00066 typedef struct {
00067         lnet_hdr_t              ksnm_hdr;       /* lnet hdr */
00068 
00069         /*
00070          * ksnm_payload is removed because of winnt compiler's limitation:
00071          * zero-sized array can only be placed at the tail of [nested]
00072          * structure definitions. lnet payload will be stored just after
00073          * the body of structure ksock_lnet_msg_t
00074          */
00075 } WIRE_ATTR ksock_lnet_msg_t;
00076 
00077 typedef struct {
00078         __u32                   ksm_type;       /* type of socklnd message */
00079         __u32                   ksm_csum;       /* checksum if != 0 */
00080         __u64                   ksm_zc_cookies[2]; /* Zero-Copy request/ACK cookie */
00081         union {
00082                 ksock_lnet_msg_t lnetmsg;       /* lnet message, it's empty if it's NOOP */
00083         } WIRE_ATTR ksm_u;
00084 } WIRE_ATTR ksock_msg_t;
00085 
00086 static inline void
00087 socklnd_init_msg(ksock_msg_t *msg, int type)
00088 {
00089         msg->ksm_csum           = 0;
00090         msg->ksm_type           = type;
00091         msg->ksm_zc_cookies[0]  = msg->ksm_zc_cookies[1]  = 0;
00092 }
00093 
00094 #define KSOCK_MSG_NOOP          0xc0            /* ksm_u empty */
00095 #define KSOCK_MSG_LNET          0xc1            /* lnet msg */
00096 
00097 /* We need to know this number to parse hello msg from ksocklnd in
00098  * other LND (usocklnd, for example) */
00099 #define KSOCK_PROTO_V2          2
00100 #define KSOCK_PROTO_V3          3
00101 
00102 #endif
